answers.author: John Garvison
answers.text:
As a former external municipal auditor and then someone who went through two accounting software package upgrades while I was with the County, I can tell you which ones not to even think about purchasing. Email me if you are interested in ones we saw numerous problems with.
That being said, once you decide upon two or more software providers you are interested in, get a list of all of their customers and then pick customers that might be like your jurisdicttion to contact and see if they would be willing to discuss the pros and cons of the software you are thinking about purchasing. Also, don't just ask for some references from the company you are researching, ask for their entire customer list, that way, the company has not handpicked the references you will check on them.
Good luck, I went through a few major software conversions in my time, and each one has their unique challenges and opportunities.

author: Nicole Shank
text:
Has anyone recently gone out for an RFP for accounting software?  I am an Assistant Administrator in VA, and most localities in VA are using a system called Bright.  This is a DOS based system, and not user friendly in the least.  If you've recently replaced your accounting software, I am interested in the selected software, and whether you are content with your selection.  Also, if you could attached the RFP used, I would certainly appreciate it.
Thank you!
title: RFP for accounting software
